trans-unit.source: List Operating Systems
trans-unit.target: List Operating Systems

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>List Operating Systems</languageKeyword> operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>List Operating Systems</languageKeyword> operation lists the versions of the guest operating system that are currently available in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>List Operating Systems</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>List Operating Systems</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: GET
trans-unit.target: GET

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2010-04-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2010-04-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the format of the response body:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the format of the response body:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements in the response body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements in the response body.

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operating system.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operating system.

trans-unit.source: This value corresponds to the configuration value for specifying that your service is to run on a particular version of the Azure guest operating system.
trans-unit.target: This value corresponds to the configuration value for specifying that your service is to run on a particular version of the Azure guest operating system.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="a13bb7d4-3270-45a1-bc11-91ce0ab09f55" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Guest OS Update Settings</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="a13bb7d4-3270-45a1-bc11-91ce0ab09f55" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Guest OS Update Settings</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Specifies the base-64 encoded label of the operating system version.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the base-64 encoded label of the operating system version.

trans-unit.source: IsDefault
trans-unit.target: IsDefault

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether this operating system version is the default version for a service that has not otherwise specified a particular version.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether this operating system version is the default version for a service that has not otherwise specified a particular version.

trans-unit.source: The default operating system version is applied to services that are configured for auto-upgrade.
trans-unit.target: The default operating system version is applied to services that are configured for auto-upgrade.

trans-unit.source: An operating system family has exactly one default operating system version at any given time, for which the <languageKeyword>IsDefault</languageKeyword> element is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>; for all other versions, <languageKeyword>IsDefault</languageKeyword> is set to false.
trans-unit.target: An operating system family has exactly one default operating system version at any given time, for which the <languageKeyword>IsDefault</languageKeyword> element is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>; for all other versions, <languageKeyword>IsDefault</languageKeyword> is set to false.

trans-unit.source: IsActive
trans-unit.target: IsActive

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether this operating system version is currently active for running a service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether this operating system version is currently active for running a service.

trans-unit.source: If an operating system version is active, you can manually configure your service to run on that version.
trans-unit.target: If an operating system version is active, you can manually configure your service to run on that version.

trans-unit.source: An operating system version may be inactive for one of two reasons:
trans-unit.target: An operating system version may be inactive for one of two reasons:

trans-unit.source: It is not yet active as it is in the process of being rolled out to Azure data centers.
trans-unit.target: It is not yet active as it is in the process of being rolled out to Azure data centers.

trans-unit.source: If your service is configured to use auto-upgrade, it will be upgraded to the new operating system version during the rollout.
trans-unit.target: If your service is configured to use auto-upgrade, it will be upgraded to the new operating system version during the rollout.

trans-unit.source: If you are manually configuring your operating system version, you can upgrade to the latest version once it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: If you are manually configuring your operating system version, you can upgrade to the latest version once it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: It is no longer supported for running a service.
trans-unit.target: It is no longer supported for running a service.

trans-unit.source: In this case you will either need to manually configure your service to run on a newer version, or configure your service to use auto-upgrade to manage operating system upgrades.
trans-unit.target: In this case you will either need to manually configure your service to run on a newer version, or configure your service to use auto-upgrade to manage operating system upgrades.

trans-unit.source: Family
trans-unit.target: Family

trans-unit.source: Indicates which operating system family this version belongs to.
trans-unit.target: Indicates which operating system family this version belongs to.

trans-unit.source: For information about supported Guest OS releases, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about supported Guest OS releases, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/ee924680.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Family Label
trans-unit.target: Family Label

trans-unit.source: Specifies the base-64 encoded label of the operating system family.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the base-64 encoded label of the operating system family.
